description_txt: stated on September 28, 2012 in a news release:
quote_txt: Says Tammy Baldwin introduced a bill that would require doctors and other health care workers to ask patients, "including young children, whether they are gay, lesbian, bisexual, or if they know their gender identity."

description_txt: stated on October 22, 2012 in the third presidential debate in Boca Raton, Fla.:
quote_txt: "Veterans’ unemployment is actually now lower than (the) general population. It was higher when I came into office."

description_txt: stated on October 22, 2012 in the third presidential debate in Boca Raton, Fla.:
quote_txt: "I went to the Olympics that was out of balance, and we got it on balance."

description_txt: stated on October 22, 2012 in a presidential debate:
quote_txt: "The president said he was going to create daylight between ourselves and Israel."

description_txt: stated on October 22, 2012 in a presidential debate:
quote_txt: "A few months ago when you were asked what's the biggest geopolitical threat facing America, you said Russia."

description_txt: stated on October 16, 2012 in the second presidential debate:
quote_txt: Says a university survey concluded his Massachusetts administration "had more women in senior leadership positions than any other state in America."

description_txt: stated on September 28, 2012 in a TV ad.:
quote_txt: "Virginia papers called (Scott) Rigell’s campaign ‘Mostly False.’"

description_txt: stated on September 26, 2012 in an ad “Dancing,” released September 26, 2012.:
quote_txt: Ann McLane Kuster is "for a government takeover of health care more radical than Obamacare. And she supports a $700 billion cut to Medicare for current retirees."

description_txt: stated on September 6, 2012 in an ad, “Janice,” released September 6, 2012:
quote_txt: Says U.S. Rep. Charles Bass wants to privatize Social Security.

description_txt: stated on October 16, 2012 in a town hall meeting in West Milford:
quote_txt: "Now remember, property taxes went up 70 percent in the 10 years before I became governor."

description_txt: stated on October 17, 2012 in a campaign commercial:
quote_txt: "Jim Renacci tried to avoid paying taxes on nearly $14 million that he made."

description_txt: stated on October 1, 2012 in a television ad:
quote_txt: "Women who have miscarriages could be investigated by police" under legislation supported by Republican state Senate candidate Rick Gudex.

description_txt: stated on October 8, 2012 in a debate.:
quote_txt: "The poverty rate amongst women is the worst it’s been in 17 years and the extreme poverty rate is the worst it’s ever been."

description_txt: stated on October 16, 2012 in article:
quote_txt: Virginia’s educational level among whites is higher than Georgia’s.

description_txt: stated on October 16, 2012 in a debate:
quote_txt: "There are more oil rigs in operation in the United States than the rest of the world combined."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • October 22, 2012

description_txt: stated on October 11, 2012 in a mailer sent for a state legislative campaign.:
quote_txt: Says House Democrats "voted to use your tax dollars for abortions" by voting against bill defunding Planned Parenthood.

description_txt: stated on October 11, 2012 in a debate:
quote_txt: Says Barack Obama "said when he was running for office four years ago that he would halve the annual deficit by the end of his first term. That simply has not happened."

description_txt: stated on October 16, 2012 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: Says Tammy Baldwin "voted to gut Medicare for seniors."

description_txt: stated on October 16, 2012 in a debate:
quote_txt: "While I was mayor of the city of Providence we had the lowest crime rate in 30 years."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • October 21, 2012

description_txt: stated on September 21, 2012 in a radio interview:
quote_txt: Says an arts tax would provide "funding for certified arts and music teachers for every elementary school serving Portland residents."

description_txt: stated on October 17, 2012 in the Florida U.S. Senate debate:
quote_txt: Says Connie Mack voted to redefine "rape" as "forcible rape."

description_txt: stated on October 10, 2012 in in a mailer:
quote_txt: Says Mitt Romney and George Allen "would overturn Roe v. Wade and allow states to end safe, legal abortion even in cases of rape, incest or when a woman's life is at risk."

description_txt: stated on October 17, 2012 in a debate:
quote_txt: "I’ve got a 94 percent" career voting record in Congress while Bill Nelson has "a 92 percent voting record."

description_txt: stated on October 16, 2012 in in a town hall debate:
quote_txt: "George Bush never suggested that we eliminate funding for Planned Parenthood."

description_txt: stated on October 11, 2012 in a campaign ad:
quote_txt: As a Member of Congress, Chris Murphy "was raking in $1 million in salary."

description_txt: stated on October 1, 2012 in a press conference.:
quote_txt: Says fewer than 30 percent of Texas college students graduate in four years and only 58 percent graduate within six years.

description_txt: stated on October 14, 2012 in a letter to the editor.:
quote_txt: Says the University of Texas can afford to build a medical school because it has a $7 billion endowment and its football program had a $50 million profit last year.

description_txt: stated on October 19, 2012 in an election flier :
quote_txt: "President Barack Obama (is) the first president in history to cut Medicare by $700 billion."

description_txt: stated on May 10, 2012 in a mailed campaign flier:
quote_txt: Says he "is the reason we do not pay a toll every time we pass over the bridge at MoPac and William Cannon."

description_txt: stated on October 12, 2012 in a campaign mailer:
quote_txt: Laurie Monnes Anderson "voted to let violent criminals out of jail early."
